title: Scottish court dismisses bid to stop Boris Johnson's Brexit deal
text:
A Scottish judge has quashed a bid to have Boris Johnson’s Brexit deal declared unlawful.

Lord Pentland, ruling in the latest Brexit challenge raised at Scotland’s highest civil court, said the case was of “very doubtful competency” and the orders being sought would have interfered with the proceedings of Parliament.

The Court of Session in Edinburgh was told that the Prime Minister’s deal was in breach of UK law because it contravened legislation preventing Northern Ireland forming part of a separate customs territory.

The case was brought by Jolyon Maugham QC, of the Good Law Project, who wanted the new withdrawal agreement suspended.

Aidan O'Neill QC, acting for the petitioner, told the court...
description: A Scottish judge has quashed a bid to have Boris Johnson’s Brexit deal declared unlawful.
